result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracey M. Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tracey M. Simmons is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tracey M. Simmons was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Tracey M. Simmons was found guilty of County Retail Theft-Intentionally Take. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: TC from Ms. Simmons - she was recently fired from her job and has no money to send a payment, also has not completed and returned payment plan application. Ms. Simmons was informed that her fine total is almost $3600 and payments need to be sent in on a regular basis, she again repeated she was fired and couldn't "pull it out of the trees" - the possiblity of a warrant was explained.

ADDRESS INFO for Tracey M. Simmons
Current: 933 A Main Street #D, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-11-2017)
Prior: 1417 Rogers St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Defendant called and stated she needs to get payment plan application completed and back to us. Sent out to defendant.
Per Traci - remove from calendar - payment plan initiated
Mother came in and made payment of $75/10 - did not have payment plan - gave her another plan to have tracey fill out and fax back ASAP

3:37 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Calling 15cm184, 15ct150, 16cm119, 15cm169, 14tr1775. Defendant moved to Stevens Point. Had 3 jobs and was fired from all 3 jobs - only because she didn't fit in. Starts tomorrow at coffee shop on Main Street in Stevens Point. Not sure where she is going to be living; roommate doesn't like clean people so she is getting kicked out. Court approves $75 monthly payment plan. Court advises of $10 payment plan fee. Payment plan to begin August 1, 2017. Court reiterates payment plan information. Adj. 3:41 p.m.

3:29 pm Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Calling 15cm169, 15cm184, 15ct150, 16cm119, 14tr1775,  Defendant states that she lost job in December and could not find job in Rhinelander - moved to Stevens Point.  Just obtained 2 jobs within walking distance of residence. Court orders defendant to bring paycheck stub to next hearing. Court approves $75 monthly payment at this time to begin April, 2017 - will review at next hearing. Adj. 3:32 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tracey M. Simmons
Current: 1417 Rogers St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2017)
Prior: 5897 W. Highway 8 - A, Rhinelander, WI 54501
From defendant, will be making 3 months were of payments  ($60 x 3) prior to 3/20/17 and will request an extention after that.

3:16 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Calling 15cm169, 15cm184, 15ct150, 16cm119, 14tr1775. Defendant now working at Arby's. Defendant states she can afford $50 per month. Court sets $60 payment plan for now until Defendant's financial status improves. Court will allow community service at a rate of $10 per hour. Defendant to coordinate with PO for speaking at schools and if speaking in school will allow $15 per hour. Court cautions defendant to obtain approval. Court allows first payment to be made January 1, 2017. Adj. 3:21 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court, in custody, via video. Calling 16cm119, 15cm184,15cm169, 14tr1775. Defendant states she works at Arby's 30-35 hours per week; makes $9.50 per hour. Has been making regular monthly payments. Has not missed. Court states she has missed payments. Court sets $100 payment. Court will quash warrants with $25 payment from defendant and $50 payment from mother; defendant will be released after payments are made. Adj. 1:37 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
per Brandi @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO

2:08 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15ct150, 16cm42 and 16cm119. In 15ct150 - State moves dismiss Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. Plea questinnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Burns/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
In 15ct150
WHS/POP- 2 years
Fine - $1429
Jail- 5 days with Huber for all purposes to commence Monday, April 11, 2016 at 8:00 a.m. 
Jail credit - to be determined 
Drivers License Revocation - 12 months
IID - 12 months
Drivers' Safety Plan
AODA Assessment
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given-Court will allow this case to be added to current payment plan - $50 monthly payment

In 16cm119, State moves to amend Count 1 to ordinance retail theft - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 4 and 5 -Granted. Defendant enters no contest to Counts 1 and 3. Court finds guilty and imposes fine in amount of $263.50 and costs only on Count 3. 

In 16cm42 - State moves to dismiss - Granted. 
Appeal rights given. 
Adj. 2:26 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:42 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mary Burns appears-states she had represented previously-has a resolution in other cases.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Schiek/Burns statement on bond. Court sets $ cash bond. Adj. 1:49 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
